channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump launches frenzied campaign push after hospitalization
These GOP senators are distancing themselves from Trump
item.description: CNN's Brianna Keilar breaks down how some vulnerable Republican senators are attempting to distance themselves from President Donald Trump ahead of the 2020 election.

item.title: 5 takeaways from the first day of hearings for Amy Coney Barrett
Amy Klobuchar slams hearing as a 'sham' in her opening statement
item.description: Sen. Amy Klobuchar (D-MN) delivers her statement at the confirmation hearing for Judge Amy Coney Barrett, where Klobuchar calls the hearing a "sham."

item.title: China to test entire city of 9 million people as Covid-19 cluster detected
US state has less than 20 hospital beds left as Covid-19 cases surge
CNN anchor questions Russian CEO about vaccine transparency
item.description: CNN's Becky Anderson speaks to Kirill Dmitriev, the CEO of the Russian Direct Investment Fund, about the Russian trials for a coronavirus vaccine.

item.title: Microsoft takes down massive hacking operation that could have affected the election
item.description: Microsoft has disrupted a massive hacking operation that it said could have indirectly affected election infrastructure if allowed to continue.

item.title: Top US general pushes back at national security adviser's troop withdrawal announcement
item.description: America's most senior general publicly pushed back Sunday at an announcement by President Donald Trump's national security adviser that the US will aggressively reduce the number of troops in Afghanistan by the end of the year irrespective of conditions on the ground.

item.title: Malaysia detains Chinese vessels for trespassing in territorial waters
item.description: Maritime authorities in Malaysia said they stopped six Chinese fishing vessels in Malaysian territorial waters Saturday, as Beijing increases its presence throughout the South China Sea.

item.title: Wife of Pennsylvania lieutenant governor called n-word while grocery shopping
item.description: The wife of Pennsylvania's lieutenant governor alleges she was insulted with a racial slur while grocery shopping this week.

item.title: John McCain's mother, Roberta, dies at 108
item.description: The late Sen. John McCain's mother died on Monday at age 108, according to his widow, Cindy McCain.

item.title: Tourist returns stolen artifacts to Pompeii after suffering 'curse' for 15 years
item.description: A Canadian woman has returned five artifacts she took from Pompeii in 2005, saying they have plagued her with bad luck.

item.title: Magnus Carlsen's record 125-game unbeaten streak ends
item.description: All good things must come to an end, and so it was that Magnus Carlsen's record-breaking streak without defeat in classical chess was halted by Jan-Krzysztof Duda on Saturday.

item.title: Police use water cannons against protesters in Nigeria
item.description: Nigeria's Special Anti-Robbery Squad, a controversial police unit accused of brutality, will be disbanded following nationwide protests demanding an end to police violence in the country. CNN's Stephanie Busari reports.

item.title: British Airways CEO quits as 'worst crisis' in aviation history rolls on
item.description: Alex Cruz is stepping down as chairman and chief executive of British Airways as its owner, International Airlines Group (IAG), reshuffles top management to tackle the worst crisis in aviation history.

item.title: Another huge round of airline losses is coming
item.description: The second quarter was the worst financial hit in the history of the airline industry. The third-quarter results won't be much better.

item.title: CNN's Jake Tapper: History won't be kind to those enabling Trump
item.description: CNN's Jake Tapper lays out the ways in which President Trump's Cabinet secretaries are making politicized moves ahead of the 2020 presidential election.

item.title: Tensions spike between Greece and Turkey as Ankara sends ship to disputed waters
item.description: Tensions spiked between Greece and Turkey on Monday over offshore rights in the eastern Mediterranean, with Athens vowing to push its European Union (EU) peers to activate sanctions against Ankara.

item.title: Kim Jong Un gets emotional over Covid efforts
item.description: Kim Jong Un choked up before praising North Korea's "anti-epidemic" efforts and unveiling a new ballistic missile. Neither Kim, nor any crowd members appeared to be wearing masks.

item.title: Why US sanctions on China's Ant Group may be an empty threat
item.description: Washington could soon expand its war against Chinese tech companies by setting its sights on Ant Group, the crown jewel of billionaire Jack Ma's empire.

item.title: 'Goldfinger' actress Margaret Nolan dead at 76
item.description: Margaret Nolan, an actress and model who famously featured covered in gold paint in the title sequence for the James Bond movie "Goldfinger," has died at the age of 76.

item.title: The new iPhone is for people who drive Toyota Camrys
item.description: Since 2007, Apple has made the best, most popular smartphone on the planet. The company is expected to launch the new-and-improved iPhone 12 this week, and you can be assured it'll come with the Apple-approved "it just works" experience Steve Jobs fought for.

item.title: This rare star system that astronomers never expected to find is a 'ticking time bomb'
item.description: A rare star system has been found in our Milky Way galaxy, but it's doomed to end in a massive explosion.

item.title: 'All I can do is pray': 60-year-old cook facing homelessness
item.description: As the Covid-19 pandemic continues to surge in the US, Dallas residents like Diane Lusk are struggling to find relief. CNN's Ed Lavandera reports.

item.title: Airbus has a plane with flapping wingtips -- and they just got even longer
item.description: Since the dawn of aviation, birds have been an inspiration for visionaries of flight. And now, engineers are once again looking to feathered friends to inspire the next generation of aircraft wings.

item.title: Autistic teen draws in black after mom got Covid-19
item.description: Nahla al-Nadawi's 19-year-old son Ussayid is autistic and expresses himself through colorful artwork. Since caring for his mother and stepfather while they were sick with Covid-19, his drawings have taken a somber turn. CNN's Arwa Damon reports.

item.title: Australian Prime Minister's car vandalized by protesters
item.description: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison was targeted with tomatoes and fake blood, and his car was vandalized by protesters during a visit to the University of Queensland on Monday, CNN affiliates 9 News and 7 News reported.

item.title: Gal Gadot to play Cleopatra in upcoming movie directed by Patty Jenkins
item.description: Actress Gal Gadot will be playing the Queen of the Nile.

item.title: How LeBron James stacks up against basketball's greats
item.description: It's the perennial question. Who is better, Wilt Chamberlain or Bill Russell? Kareem Abdul-Jabbar or Larry Bird? Magic Johnson or Michael Jordan?

item.title: How America's schools have started the new year in the pandemic
item.description: Initial data from Brown University suggests the spread of coronavirus in schools may not be as rampant as feared. But not everyone is ready to go back to in-person learning. CNN's Bianna Golodryga reports.

item.title: Premier League's future up for grabs as 'Project Big Picture' comes into view
item.description: Buffeted by a global pandemic, the future of the English Premier League -- whose 20 clubs in 2018/19 delivered total revenue of over $6.5 billion for the first time in his history -- appears to be up for grabs.

item.title: Inside a small-town Native American beauty pageant
item.description: Each year, pageants like Miss Native American and Miss Indian World invite indigenous women from around the United States to represent historically disenfranchised tribes and celebrate their cultural heritage.

item.title: The American man who became a porter on Everest
item.description: It might not seem that way when you read harrowing accounts of climbers perishing on its treacherous slopes, but there's an easy way to climb Everest, and there's a hard way.

item.title: 'SNL' takes on Vice Presidential debate
item.description: 'SNL' took on the Vice Presidential debate with Maya Rudolph as Kamala Harris, Beck Bennett as Mike Pence, and a starring turn from the famous housefly.

item.title: Earth's first mammals took it easy and lived far longer than their modern counterparts
item.description: Earth's earliest mammals spent their lives at a more leisurely pace than their modern counterparts, but they lived a lot longer, analysis of some 200-million-year-old teeth has shown.

item.title: Young Americans more likely to say no to alcohol, study finds
item.description: Call them Generation Dry. More college-age Americans are choosing not to drink alcohol than they did nearly two decades ago, according to a new study.

item.title: Teenager sets world records for longest legs
item.description: A 17-year-old named Maci Currin has set two Guinness World Records for having the longest legs.

item.title: Astronomers witness 'spaghettification' of star shredded by a black hole
item.description: A black hole enjoyed one stellar spaghetti dinner and astronomers were able to witness the event from 215 million light-years away in a spiral galaxy in the Eridanus constellation.

item.title: Sei Young Kim wins first major at Women's PGA Championship
item.description: Sei Young Kim claimed the first major title of her career at the Women's PGA Championship with a record-equaling final round 63.

item.title: Video shows unmanned boat flying into air before crash
item.description: Three men reportedly doing a photo shoot on a boat in Florida somehow fell overboard, leaving the vessel unmanned and out of control before it hit two docks near the coastline.

item.title: The new app encouraging us to spread positivity via 'love taps'
item.description: We could all do with a little more positive human connection these days. At least that's what the folks behind design company Frosty Pop think -- and they have decided to do something about it.

item.title: US President's aides downplay his health as he hits trail in attempt to reverse flagging reelection fortunes
item.description: The next three weeks will likely amount to the busiest of President Donald Trump's tenure, at least in terms of schedule and travel, pushing the 74-year-old President fresh from his coronavirus hospitalization -- which included supplemental oxygen and a fever -- into a frenzied final campaign offensive.

item.title: Trump has tested negative on consecutive days, his doctor says
item.description: White House physician Sean Conley said Monday President Donald Trump has tested negative for Covid-19 on consecutive days, as the President heads to a crowded campaign rally in Florida.

item.title: Fauci says Trump campaign should take down ad featuring him
item.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci said Monday that the Trump campaign should take down the political advertisement that he's featured in, calling his presence in the spot "really unfortunate and really disappointing."

item.title: McConnell warns Democrats are 'on fire' as GOP falls behind on fundraising and polling
item.description: Republican candidates are increasingly worried about President Donald Trump's unpopularity and the drag it might be having on races down the ballot, as Democratic candidates rack up stunning fundraising numbers in the final weeks of the campaign.

item.title: Analysis: Lesson for Trump in fall of a 'law and order' president
item.description: Americans are on the eve of a momentous political choice this November. But for a jump on how the story goes from here, consider what happened in France, where another "back to normal" candidate challenged a firebrand incumbent.

item.title: 5 takeaways from the first day of Amy Coney Barrett's confirmation hearings
item.description: • Kamala Harris blasts GOP for using Barrett to do 'their dirty work'

item.title: China to test entire city of 9 million people in five days
item.description: The Chinese port city of Qingdao plans to test some nine million people in the coming five days, after 12 locally-transmitted coronavirus cases were reported sparking concerns of a wider outbreak.

item.title: Parts of Europe prepare to take drastic action
item.description: European countries including Italy and England are mulling strict new measures to stop the spread of the coronavirus, as cases on the continent continue to soar.
